author: Cline

review: I bought it on Sept. 2nd 2014. It was great because I have a prime account and there is enough free content to satisfy me and the availability of a variety of movies for rent is very nice. HOWEVER!!!! It is now Nov. 8, 2014 and THE REMOTE BROKE!I have replaced the batteries with 2 different sets of new batteries because I wanted to be sure I didn't somehow get some bad batteries from a new package. I have looked up other reviews and found that this is a common problem. You can purchase a new remote for $30 but having only had the unit for 2 months and knowing how I treat my Amazon Fire remote like the delicate piece of electronics that it is, I am VERY displeased. If the remote would continue to work I would give a much higher review.I will also NOT be buying a new remote. If I have to spend $30 every 2-5 months for a new remote I will just live without the Amazon Fire.
author: mddow1s

review: I have both a ROKU and a Fire TV (bought the ROKU 1st) as I have dropped cable and am piecing together my alternative solutions. The Fire TV seems slightly more responsive and the overall user interface seems cleaner and more intuitive. Searching on both is a pain so I've gotten in the habit of using my computer to periodically add everything I might want to watch to my queue (or favorites or whatever the specific service calls it) on Netflix, Amazon and HULU. I'm trying to decide which to buy for the 3rd TV and still can't decide. Since I make my primary selections on the computer both devices are good choices. I don't see how searching can be made much better when all you have is a remote control.
